description.narrative: The Australia-InterAmerican Development Bank/Multilateral Investment Fund (MIF) Partnership Trust Fund for Poverty Reduction in Latin America has funded 21 projects in 11 Latin American countries and 3 regional eligible and jointly agreed projects to increase financial services for the poor in Latin America. Projects were identified, scoped, designed and managed by the MIF using their existing administration and management processes and Australia will assess each under the Risk And Value analysis and Quality Standards for projects' design. All projects approved have an implementing period which extends to more than three years, being June 2019 the end date for some of them. No further disbursements nor contribution from Australia is expected. The total value of Australia's contribution to the Fund is $10.0 million over 3 years, starting 2010-11.
